definition[0]: feeling that you want to sleep or rest
example[1]: ‘No, ’ Frank said in a tired voice.
example[2]: I’m so tired I could sleep for a week.
example[3]: He was too tired to argue.
explanation[0]: If you are tired of doing something, you do not want to do it anymore because it has started to annoy or bore you
explanation[1]: If you are tired from doing something, you feel tired because you have used a lot of effort
example[6]: He was tired from walking all day
bad_example[1]: He was tired of walking all day
example[7]: I was really tired the next day.
example[8]: the tired faces of the children
example[9]: I was exhausted after the long trip home.
example[11]: She immediately fell into an exhausted sleep.
definition[2]: very tired because you have been working hard
example[12]: With three small children to care for, she was always worn out.
definition[3]: tired because you have been travelling, worrying, or doing something for a long time
example[15]: He looks tired and weary after 20 years in office.
example[16]: They were too fatigued to continue with the climb.
example[17]: Because of her illness, she often became fatigued.
definition[4]: very tired and feeling as if all your energy has gone
example[18]: Afterwards, he felt drained, both physically and mentally.
example[19]: I’m bushed. I think I’ll go to bed early.
example[20]: I’m beat. I don’t think I’ll go for a run tonight.
definition[5]: very tired. Knackered is a very informal use – do not use it in polite conversation
example[21]: By the time I got home I was absolutely knackered.
example[22]: When I first started teaching, I came home shattered every night.
definition[6]: extremely tired, so that you cannot do anything but sleep
example[23]: I was absolutely dead by the time I got home.
definition[7]: wanting to sleep very soon, so that your eyes start to close
example[24]: I’m feeling quite sleepy. I think I’ll go to bed.
definition[8]: starting to sleep because you are in a warm place, have drunk too much alcohol, or have taken medicine
example[26]: The tablets can make you feel drowsy.
example[27]: She was beginning to feel a little drowsy after all the food and wine she had consumed.
display[9]: can’t keep your eyes open/can hardly keep your eyes open
definition[9]: to feel so tired that you find it difficult to stay awake
example[28]: I’d better get some rest – I can’t keep my eyes open.
example[29]: He had been driving all night, and he could hardly keep his eyes open.
